report_title: Credit Card Processing & Money Transferring in the US
executive_summary: The Credit Card Processing and Money Transferring industry offers financial transaction processing, reserve and clearinghouse services. The industry generates its revenue through processing and transaction fees via credit and debit card purchases. The value of credit card transactions determines the fees processors collect from merchants. Rising consumer spending over most of the past five years has largely supported growth. More notably, processors have reaped the benefits of the large-scale application of electronic payment technology and growing e-commerce during the five-year period. The adoption of electronic payments was accelerated by the coronavirus, which shifted consumers toward online shopping platforms following lockdown measures.

current_performance.current_performance_point_description: Steady increases in the volume of electronic payment transactions and the number of businesses that have become credit card friendly sustained strong industry revenue growth. Expanded use of debit and credit cards, coupled with rising consumer spending and per capita disposable income, led to steady increases in industry revenue over much of the five-year period.

Industry revenue has increased at a CAGR of 2.8% to $114.8 billion through the end of 2023, including an increase of 2.7% in 2023 alone. The coronavirus had an uneven effect on the industry's largest service providers. While some processors experienced declines as consumer spending fell, other companies experienced unprecedented growth as retailers adopted contactless payment options en masse.

future_outlook.future_outlook_point_description: Dissipating pandemic concerns over the next five years will support steady revenue growth. Rising consumer spending is expected to drive growth, especially as a greater share of transactions are expected to be fielded by the industry. In the outlook period, consumers will increasingly adopt contactless payment methods. So, processors will expand their online capabilities, as merchants shift to accept electronic payment methods to meet shifting consumer preferences.

future_outlook.future_outlook_point_title: Cash and Check Declines Benefit the Industry
future_outlook.future_outlook_point_description: Electronic transactions have increasingly replaced cash and check purchases as a more efficient method of making payments for consumers and businesses, with recent data from the Federal Reserve Bank of Atlanta noting that close to two-thirds of clients use an online payment platform for their purchase needs.
E-commerce and mobile commerce trends support demand for credit card processing, with consumers increasingly making more purchases online and requiring reliable electronic payment methods.

industry_definition: This industry offers financial transaction processing, reserve and liquidity services and check or other financial instrument clearinghouse services. The industry excludes electronic transactions associated with the US Federal Reserve.

positive_impact_factors: Barriers To Entry Level: high - decreasing

threats: Security issues and data breaches pose a threat to growth

key_trends: Credit and debit card transaction volumes are increasing, supporting industry revenue growth. The proliferation of technology among downstream clients has accelerated credit card usage and dampened consumers' propensity to use cash.

Consolidation is increasing as larger players continue to acquire smaller entrants. With the Federal Reserve continuing to raise interest rates to combat inflation, larger operators have been motivated to acquire smaller credit card processors to gain a competitive edge.
The industry is supported by several organizations and associations. These entities act to ensure the efficient flow of payment transactions.

Service providers are subject to a variety of operating rules and regulations. Primarily, they must abide by the network operating rules put out by the National Automated Clearing House Association (NACHA).
Increased credit card availability benefits service providers. Consumers from all income brackets are able to get approved for credit cards, benefiting the industry.
Increased consumer spending supports demand from merchants. Particularly retail spending, as consumer preferences have been moving toward electronic payment options and away from cash.
Geographic distribution follows the population. The Credit Card Processing and Money Transferring industry generally follows the distribution of the population.
Lower-cost commercial real estate attracts service providers
Low fees and benefits attract customers
Profit has dropped due to rising wages

market_segmentation.segment_description: This segment includes all merchants (businesses or individuals that provide goods or services). Services provided to merchants involve the processing of bank cards and check transactions and various forms of automated clearinghouse services. This segment's main driver is consumer spending, particularly retail spending, as consumer preferences have moved toward electronic payment options and away from cash.

This segment includes banks or financial institutions. Industry operators serve banks by processing automatic teller machine (ATM) transactions and other money transfer transactions. Increased merger and acquisition activity among banks has resulted in a smaller client base for processors. This has contributed to banks' share of revenue decreasing over the last five years. Banks are increasingly developing and using their own transaction processing systems, relying less on the services of industry operators to cut costs and boost profit.

This segment includes US, state or local government entities. Government entities have sought out ways to cut costs and increase efficiencies. By shifting to electronic payments instead of paper-based payments, government groups can cut costs and improve efficiency, control and security. The government uses prepaid credit cards to disperse some of its benefits, which increase during recessions, helping to boost this segment's share of revenue.

products_and_services.product_description: Credit card services include settling funds through bank associations, including depositing funds to the merchant's accounts on a fee basis, which is generated as a percentage of the transaction value.

These services include cobranding debit cards, e-pay services for high-volume merchants, automatic bill payer services and cash-back services for frequent card usage. Most debit cards are now associated with credit card associations, enabling cardholders to use debit cards for transactions, similar to the way credit cards are used.

An automated clearing house (ACH) is an electronic interbank payments system that is used primarily to handle small-dollar funds transfers for consumers, businesses and the government. The system consists of an infrastructure of data processing and communications hardware and software designed to deliver and settle large volumes of electronic payment transactions and related information. A consumer or a business initiates an ACH transaction through its depository institution, which transmits payment information and exchanges funds with the recipient's depository institution via transactions processed by an ACH operator.
Various other products and services related to payment processing.

tier_1_suppliers: Computer Peripheral Manufacturing in the US
Computer & Packaged Software Wholesaling in the US
tier_2_suppliers: Internet Service Providers in the US
Wireless Telecommunications Carriers in the US
tier_1_buyers: E-Commerce & Online Auctions in the US
Supermarkets & Grocery Stores in the US
Pharmacies & Drug Stores in the US

demand_determinants.determinant_description: Consumer spending measures total spending on both new and used goods by Americans, both domestically and abroad. As consumer spending increases the total amount of purchases increases, driving demand for credit card processing services. Conversely, a decline in consumer spending reduces purchase transactions.

Consumer confidence is linked to the performance of macroeconomic conditions, like the unemployment rate and per capita disposable. As economic conditions improve, consumers feel more confident in the economy and increase the frequency and value of purchases, positively affecting industry revenue growth.
A rise in e-commerce sales increases demand for electronic payment processing services, positively affecting industry revenue growth.

Per capita disposable income determines an individual's ability to purchase goods and services. It is an important determinant of industry demand, as rising incomes translate to more purchases and transactions for operators to process.

business_locations.location_description: The Southeast accounts for the largest share of industry establishments. Since the region is home to over a quarter of the US population, it is a popular location for service providers. The price of commercial real estate is comparatively lower in this region, lowering operating costs.

The West is the second-largest region by establishments for the industry. California is the largest state in the region by establishment. Several major players are in California because of the high population and disposable income.

The Mid-Atlantic is one of the most popular regions for processors to locate, outpacing its share of the population. New York, Pennsylvania, and New Jersey lead the region because they are densely populated and home to major US cities. Processors locate in New York City since it is a major financial hub.

regulations_points.regulation_description: Industry operators are subject to network operating rules put out by the NACHA, which is an electronic payments association that develops electronic solutions to improve the ACH payment system in the United States.
Under the Bank Secrecy Act transactions involving currency greater than $10,000 or the purchase of monetary instruments for cash in amounts between $3,000 and $10,000 must be reported.

regulations_points.regulation_title: The Dodd-Frank Wall Street Reform and Consumer Protection Act
regulations_points.regulation_description: The Dodd-Frank Act implements financial regulatory reform in the financial services industry. Once the act was passed, the Financial Stability Oversight Council (FSOC) was created to oversee and coordinate the efforts of the primary US financial regulatory agencies in establishing regulations to address financial stability concerns.

basis_points.basis_description: Providers compete on the unit price of transactions. This price varies with the amount of processing involved in the transaction and is affected by economies of scale.

basis_points.basis_title: Quality of operations and customer service
basis_points.basis_description: The overall quality of an industry player's operations and customer service remains a top factor in attracting and retaining new business.

concentration_points.concentration_description: The industry is fragmented because it comprises a wide variety of companies with different specialties. Industry services include a variety of financial transactions, including check processing, automated clearinghouse (ACH) payments, wire transfers, debit card servicing, and credit card purchases.

concentration_points.concentration_title: E-commerce lowers barriers to entry for smaller processors
concentration_points.concentration_description: Due to the rise of e-commerce, smaller players have been entering the market, promoting technologically innovative platforms for consumers, merchants, and banks. While small operators can create a platform that caters to a specific niche, as they grow they become acquisition targets for large, established industry operators.

cost_factors.cost_factor_description: Other expenses include transaction costs and other miscellaneous costs. Miscellaneous costs include employee benefits, third-party fees, general administrative costs and professional services costs, like attorney and accountant fees.

capital_intensity_points.capital_intensity_title: Advanced technology requires higher employee wages
capital_intensity_points.capital_intensity_description: Processors have increased the hiring of employees with advanced technological and engineering backgrounds to help implement the infrastructure needed to process electronic payment forms. This has increased the need for high skilled labor.

capital_intensity_points.capital_intensity_title: Low rate of new patent technologies
capital_intensity_points.capital_intensity_description: The rate of new patent technologies entering the industry is low, which limits the potential for innovations.
The concentration of technologies is high in this industry. This suggests that industry operators have exposure to potentially unforeseen areas of innovation.
The major markets for this industry are highly concentrated, which implies that the market has a focus on key customer segments.

volatility_points.volatility_title: General economic and financial activity affects volatility
volatility_points.volatility_description: As the economy expands, transaction volumes grow and industry revenue increases as more payments need to be processed. During an economic downturn, transaction volumes fall and the industry's ability to expand slows.
Revenue volatility has been mainly subdued because of consistent e-commerce spending from consumers and rising disposable incomes.

technological_change_points.technological_change_title: Debit card and prepaid card services gain popularity
technological_change_points.technological_change_description: These services include cobranding debit cards, e-pay services for high-volume merchants, automatic bill payer services and cash-back services for frequent card usage.

technological_change_points.technological_change_title: Credit card services expand in all income brackets
technological_change_points.technological_change_description: Credit card services include settling funds through bank associations, including depositing funds to the merchant's accounts on a fee basis, which is generated as a percentage of the transaction value.
Debit card has increased since debit cards are easier to obtain than credit cards and debit cards have the added convenience of the ability to withdraw cash.

technological_change_points.technological_change_title: Automated clearing house products supported by smartphones
technological_change_points.technological_change_description: An automated clearing house (ACH) is an electronic interbank payments system that is used primarily to handle small-dollar funds transfers for consumers, businesses and the government.

FAQs.question: How has the shift toward conducting business online affected demand for your services?
FAQs.answer: Credit card payment processors have benefited from an increase in online services, as it has led to increased demand for their services. New businesses that specialize in processing e-commerce payments have been formed in recent years.

FAQs.question: How diversified are your product offerings compared to competitors?
FAQs.answer: Most financial transactions are authenticated by payment processors. This enables the product offerings between competitors to potentially vary greatly. Additionally, some products have higher margins, while others can be processed with high economies of scale.

FAQs.question: What is your company doing to reduce costs?
FAQs.answer: Many payment processors have started to process electronic payments because of the long-term per unit cost savings that processing payments electronically brings them.

FAQs.question: Does your company have exposure to fintech competitors? How is it affecting your strategy moving forward?
FAQs.answer: Payment processors are constantly adjusting their strategies to assure they have the capabilities to process new payment forms that their fintech competitors have started accepting. This trend has continued in recent years as new technologies, such as cryptocurrencies and other alternative payment forms, have been created.

FAQs.question: To what extent are your processes automated and how do you plan on investing in automation over the coming years?
FAQs.answer: Payment processing has become increasingly automated in recent years. As the amount of business conducted online has increased, electronic payment processing has grown increasingly popular and prevalent.

FAQs.question: How have you taken advantage of rising internet and mobile-internet penetration into the financial services industry?
FAQs.answer: Payment processors have benefited from increasingly more business being conducted online in the form of increased demand for their services. An online transaction cannot be completed without payment processors first validating the transaction.

FAQs.question: How do you expect the proposed changes to Dodd-Frank to affect your business?
FAQs.answer: Dodd-Frank has allowed credit card processors to impose a $10.00 minimum purchase amount on transactions.

FAQs.question: Have the increased capital requirements under Basel III affected operations?
FAQs.answer: Payment processors have not been affected by Basel III as they do not extend credit to consumers themselves.

FAQs.question: Do you have enough capital reserved to be able to invest in new technology/software as soon as it becomes available?
FAQs.answer: Since technology is vitally important for payment processors, having the capital on hand to purchase new, necessary technologies is essential. This is especially the case as processors continue to improve their economies of scale, especially regarding electronic payments.

FAQs.question: How does your profit margin compare to those of your competitors?
FAQs.answer: Profit varies based on the type of payments that a business processes. For example, electronic payment processors have higher profit than check payment processors, as a higher volume of electronic payments can be processed at a lower per unit cost.

FAQs.question: Do you keep track of new and improved technology? How do you ensure your technology is updated?
FAQs.answer: Access to the latest available and most efficient technology enables companies to process more noncash payments at a lower cost, which improves profitability and generates more revenue for industry players.

FAQs.question: How can you keep costs of transactions low? Are you staying ahead of your competition?
FAQs.answer: Per unit and average costs of transactions can be reduced if economies of scale are achieved. This is particularly important to the industry, which is experiencing increased competition.

FAQs.question: What measures do you take to stay updated on government regulations? Are you prepared for increased regulation with regard to secure information?
FAQs.answer: The ability to quickly change operations and procedures to adapt to increasing government regulation contributes to a company's success. This ability to rapidly comply with regulations has been particularly important with the advent of the Consumer Financial Protection Bureau (CFPB) in recent years.

FAQs.question: How can you cater to consumers when the consumer confidence index is low? How can you better promote your product?
FAQs.answer: Improved consumer confidence leads to an increase in the frequency and value of consumer purchases, positively affecting industry revenue from transaction processing.

FAQs.question: How has the current level of regulation for this industry affected your company? How can you adapt as regulation tightens?
FAQs.answer: Increases in regulation are typically followed by slowing industry profitability due to higher costs associated with compliance with new standards. The creation of the Consumer Financial Protection Bureau (CFPB), which looks out for the financial interest of consumers, has led to more regulation for operators.

FAQs.question: How can you take advantage of an increase in e-commerce sales? What measures do you take to stay ahead of the competition?
FAQs.answer: E-commerce sales increasing leads to increased demand for electronic payment processing for industry operators, which positively affects industry revenue.
